subject: Re: [junit] New to JUnit
msgSnippet: With which part of your TreeHolder functionality have you testing problems? The build up or the state changes? Can you share (at least part of) your code base,
messageBody:
With which part of your TreeHolder functionality have you testing
problems? The build up or the state changes?
Can you share (at least part of) your code base, so that we can more
easily grasp the exact semantics?

Johannes

reply_das@... wrote:
> I have a class TreeHolder which accepts a Collection of objects and
> converts them into a Tree-like structure. In response to messages
> >from clients, the TreeHolder changes the states of various nodes
> comprising the tree.
>
> I'm unable to decide how exactly I can go about using JUnit to test
> this TreeHolder. I have already written TestCases for the individual
> nodes making up the Tree & hold the state of the node. But what about
> the TreeHolder container class? Can JUnit handle this situation?
